sen.j: この項では日本の首都（にっぽんのしゅと、にほんのしゅと）について記述する。
sen.e: In this article, we describe the history of capital and its changes in Japan.
In this article, we describe the history of capitals and their changes in Japan.
In this article, we describe the history of capitals and their changes in Japan.

sen.j: 概要
sen.e: Summary
Summary
Summary

sen.j: 首都とは国中一番のみやこ、帝城、中央政府のある所、首府のことである。
sen.e: A capital is the best city in a country, the Imperial Palace, the place where the central government is located.
A capital is the no.1 city in a country, the Imperial Palace, the place where the central government is located.
A capital is the no.1 city in a country, the Imperial Palace, the place where the central government is located.

sen.j: 日本で「首都」という語が一般化したのは第二次世界大戦後のことであり、戦前から戦後しばらくまでは「主都」（プライメイトシティ）を「首都」と記述する事例もおおく明確な区別はなかった。
sen.e: It was after the World War Ⅱ that the word " capital " was generalized, and during the period before the war and for some period after the war, there were many cases in which they described a " chief city " (primate city) as a capital and there was no clear distinction.

It was after World War Ⅱ that the word "capital" was generalized, and during the period before the war and for some period after the war, there were many cases where it was described as a "chief city" (primate city) with no clear distinction made between it and normal cities.

It was after World War Ⅱ that the word 'capital' was generalized, and during the period before the war and for some period after the war, there were many cases where it was described as a 'chief city' (primate city) with no clear distinction made between it and normal cities.

sen.j: 現在の概念にあたる首都は1868年（明治元年）以来、主に「帝都」と称され、1950年（昭和25年）の「首都建設法」制定以降になって「首都」の語が普及した。
sen.e: The capital corresponding to the present concept of capital was established in 1868, since then it has been chiefly called " the imperial capital ",and it was after the enactment of " Law of Capital Construction in 1950, that the word of " Capital " spread.

The capital corresponding to the present concept of capital was established in 1868, since then it has been chiefly called "the imperial capital,"and it was after the enactment of "Law of Capital Construction in 1950, that the term " Capital " spread into general use.

The capital corresponding to the present concept of capital was established in 1868, since then it has been chiefly called 'the imperial capital,' and it was after the enactment of 'Law of Capital Construction' in 1950, that the term 'Capital' spread into general use.
sen.cmt: スペース調整をしました。クォーテーション調整

sen.j: 日本の首都にあたるみやこは有史以来、畿内（現在の近畿地方）で遷都してきた。
sen.e: Since the dawn of history, the " Miyako " corresponding to the capital of Japan had been repeatedly relocated within provinces surrounding Kyoto and Nara.
Since the dawn of history, the " Miyako " corresponding to the capital of Japan had been repeatedly relocated within provinces surrounding Kyoto and Nara.
Since the dawn of history, the "Miyako" corresponding to the capital of Japan had been repeatedly relocated within Kinai (present Kinki region, or provinces surrounding Kyoto and Nara).
sen.cmt: 原文に沿って修正しました。

sen.j: 794年に桓武天皇により定められた平安京以来、遷都宣言により法令、憲法または現行法などで直接的な表現で定めたものはない。
sen.e: Since the transfer of capital to Heian-Kyo ruled by Emperor Kanmu, the capital had been transferred by the emperor's declaration and there were no act, laws and ordinances that directly ruled the transfer of capital.

Since the transfer of the capital to Heian-Kyo ruled by Emperor Kanmu, the capital was transferred according to the emperor's declaration and there were no act, laws or ordinances that directly affected the transfer of the capital.

Since the transfer of the capital to Heian-Kyo (the ancient capital of Japan in current Kyoto) ruled by Emperor Kanmu, the capital was transferred according to the emperor's declaration and there were no act, laws or ordinances that directly affected the transfer of the capital.
sen.cmt: 用語共有に沿って説明を追加しました。

sen.j: しかし、現在の首都は一般的には「首都建設法」（昭和25年法律第219号：廃止）により定められた東京都であるとされている。
sen.e: But the present capital is generally said to be Tokyo Metropolis, that was ruled by " the Law of Capital Construction " (law No. 219, 1950 : abolished).
But the present capital is generally said to be Tokyo Metropolis, as was ruled by " the Law of Capital Construction " (law No. 219, 1950 : abolished).
But the present capital is generally said to be Tokyo Metropolis, as was ruled by 'the Law of Capital Construction' (law No. 219, 1950: abolished).
sen.cmt: クォーテーション調整

sen.j: 「首都圏整備法」（昭和31年法律第83号）では、東京都が首都であることを前提に、東京都の区域及び政令で定めるその周辺地域（首都圏整備法施行令により、埼玉県、千葉県、神奈川県、茨城県、栃木県、群馬県及び山梨県）を首都圏と定めている。
sen.e: In " Improvement Law of Capital Zone " (law No. 83, 1954), it is prescribed that the zone of Tokyo and its surrounding area (Saitama Prefecture, Chiba Prefecture, Kanagawa Prefecture, Ibaraki Prefecture, Tochigi Prefecture, Gunma Prefecture and Yamanashi Prefecture) are the national capital region

The " Improvement Law of Capital Zone " (law No. 83, 1954), prescribes that the zone of Tokyo and its surrounding area (Saitama Prefecture, Chiba Prefecture, Kanagawa Prefecture, Ibaraki Prefecture, Tochigi Prefecture, Gunma Prefecture and Yamanashi Prefecture) are the national capital region

The 'Improvement Law of Capital Zone' (law No. 83, 1956), prescribes that the zone of Tokyo and its surrounding area (Saitama Prefecture, Chiba Prefecture, Kanagawa Prefecture, Ibaraki Prefecture, Tochigi Prefecture, Gunma Prefecture and Yamanashi Prefecture) are the national capital region

sen.j: 首都建設法は1956年（昭和31年）に廃止されており、現在有効な法（現行法）で「首都は東京都」と直接的な表現を用いて定めるものはない。
sen.e: Law of Capital Construction was abolished in 1956 and there is no existing law that rules by direct expression " the Capital is Tokyo ",
Law of Capital Construction was abolished in 1956 and there is no existing law that directly stipulates that " the Capital is Tokyo ",
Law of Capital Construction was abolished in 1956 and there is no existing law that directly stipulates that 'the Capital is Tokyo.'
sen.cmt: クォーテーション調整

sen.j: しかし東京都が首都とみなされる理由としては、日本国憲法で「日本国の象徴であり日本国民統合の象徴」と規定される天皇が常在し、皇居が東京都に所在すること、同じく憲法で国会（立法府）、首相官邸や中央省庁（行政府）、最高裁判所（司法府）という三権の最高機関のいずれもが東京都（中でも千代田区）に所在することが挙げられる。
sen.e: But as the reasons that Tokyo is regarded the Capital of Japan, it can be mentioned the following situations that Emperor who is prescribed by Japanese Constitution as " the symbol of Japan and the symbol of Japanese people's integration " is permanently stationed and the Imperial Palace is located in Tokyo, and also the highest organs of the three powers ruled by Japanese Constitution such as the Diet (legislature), the prime minister's official residence and central government ministries and agencies (administration) and the Supreme Court (administration of justice) are located in Tokyo (they are especially concentrated in Chiyoda Ward).

As for reasons supporting that Tokyo is regarded the Capital of Japan, two are generally given: the Emperor who is prescribed by Japanese Constitution as "the symbol of Japan and the symbol of Japanese people's integration" is permanently stationed and the Imperial Palace is located in Tokyo, and also the highest organs of the three powers ruled by Japanese Constitution such as the Diet (legislature), the prime minister's official residence and central government ministries and agencies (administration) and the Supreme Court (administration of justice) are located in Tokyo (they are especially concentrated in Chiyoda Ward).

As for reasons supporting that Tokyo is regarded the Capital of Japan, two are generally given: the Emperor who is prescribed by Japanese Constitution as "the symbol of Japan and the symbol of Japanese people's integration" is permanently stationed and the Imperial Palace is located in Tokyo, and also the highest organs of the three powers ruled by Japanese Constitution such as the Diet (legislature), the prime minister's official residence and central government ministries and agencies (administration) and the Supreme Court (administration of justice) are located in Tokyo (they are especially concentrated in Chiyoda Ward).

sen.j: 国会召集の詔書には、国会議事堂が所在する「東京に召集する」と書かれる。
sen.e: It is written in the imperial edict for convocation of the Diet, " Diet is levied in Tokyo " where the Diet Building is located.
It is written in the imperial edict for convocation of the Diet, " Diet is levied in Tokyo " where the Diet Building is located.
It is written in the imperial edict for convocation of the Diet, " Diet is levied in Tokyo " where the Diet Building is located.

sen.j: また、国際的にも東京都が日本の首都とみなされている。
sen.e: Moreover, Tokyo is also internationally regarded as the Capital of Japan.
Moreover, Tokyo is also internationally regarded as the Capital of Japan.
Moreover, Tokyo is also internationally regarded as the Capital of Japan.

sen.j: 国内の統計等では23の特別区（23区）が「東京」という1都市であるかのように扱われることが多い。
sen.e: In statistics within Japan, in many cases 23 boroughs in Tokyo are treated as if they are equal to one city.
For statistics within Japan, in many cases the 23 boroughs in Tokyo are treated as if they are equal to one city.
For statistics within Japan, in many cases the 23 boroughs in Tokyo are treated as if they were equal to one city.

sen.j: 一般にも東京都のうち23区を東京都内、その他の市町村を東京都下と区別することもある。
sen.e: In general 23 boroughs are treated as " inside Tokyo ", and the other local authorities are distinguished as " suburban Tokyo "
In general 23 boroughs are treated as " inside Tokyo ", and the other local authorities are distinguished as " suburban Tokyo "
In general, 23 boroughs are treated as "inside Tokyo," and the other local authorities are distinguished as "suburban Tokyo."
sen.cmt: コンマを追加しました。

sen.j: これは23区が旧東京市に相当することに由来するもので、現在では23区を一体とし自治権を有する行政単位は存在しない。
sen.e: This derives its origin from the fact that 23 boroughs were equal to old City of Tokyo, but today there is no administrative unit having autonomy for one unit of 23 boroughs.
This derives its origin from the fact that the 23 boroughs are equal to the old City of Tokyo, but today there is no administrative unit having autonomy as a single unit over the 23 boroughs.
This derives its origin from the fact that the 23 boroughs are equal to the old City of Tokyo, but today there is no administrative unit having autonomy as a single unit over the 23 boroughs.

sen.j: 一方、自治体としての東京都が公式に用いている「東京都」の英称は " Tokyo Metropolis" （metropolisは首都･首府･大都市、あるいは主要都市･中心市）で、都知事は "Governor"（知事）として国際会議に出席するなど、東京都という1つの自治体で都市の扱いになっており、対外的に23区と多摩地域や島嶼部を分離する意味はない。
sen.e: On the other hand, the common name that Tokyo officially uses, is " Tokyo Metropolis "(note, metropolis means capital, metropolis, big city or main city, central city), and the Governor of Tokyo attends the international conferences as " Governor ", soTokyo is treated as one autonomous body and there is no meaning of separating Tama area and islands area from 23 boroughs.

On the other hand, the common name that Tokyo officially uses, is " Tokyo Metropolis "(note, metropolis means capital, metropolis, big city or main city, central city), and the Governor of Tokyo attends the international conferences as " Governor ", so Tokyo is treated as a single autonomous body and there is no meaning to separate the Tama area and islands area from the 23 boroughs.

On the other hand, the common name that Tokyo officially uses, is "Tokyo Metropolis" (note, metropolis means capital, metropolis, big city or main city, central city), and the Governor of Tokyo attends the international conferences as "Governor," so Tokyo is treated as a single autonomous body and there is no meaning to separate the Tama area and islands area from the 23 boroughs.
sen.cmt: クォーテーション調整

sen.j: このように、国内的には中枢的な首都機能が集中する23区に限定して首都とすることもあるが、対外的には多摩地域や島嶼部を含めた東京都全域をもって首都とする例が多い。
sen.e: In these ways, although within Japan sometimes they treat 23 boroughs in which capital functions are concentrated as a capital, but in many cases they call the whole area of Tokyo as metropolis, including Tama area and island area.

In these ways, although within Japan sometimes they treat 23 boroughs in which capital functions are concentrated as a capital, but in many cases they call the whole area of Tokyo as metropolis, including Tama area and island area.

In these ways, it is common that domestically the 23 boroughs concentrated of capital functions are treated as a capital, while internationally the Tokyo Prefecture including Tama area and islands are regarded a capital.
sen.cmt: 原文に沿って修正しました。

sen.j: 古くは京都や奈良、及びその周辺に都（みやこ）が置かれていたことが多く、山城国、大和国、摂津国、河内国、和泉国（京都府の一部、奈良県、大阪府、兵庫県の一部）は併せて畿内（「畿」はかきね・門の内側。
sen.e: In ancient times, in many cases, capitals were located in the places near Kyoto, Nara and their surrounding area, and the area including Yamashiro Province, Yamao Province, Settsu Province, Kwachi Province and Izumi Province (part of Kyoto Prefecture, Nara Province, Osaka Province and part of Hyogo Province) were collectively called Kinai region (which means within the wall) (the five capital region provinces surrounding Kyoto and Nara,

In ancient times, in many cases, capitals were located in places near Kyoto, Nara and their surrounding area, and areas including Yamashiro Province, Yamao Province, Settsu Province, Kwachi Province and Izumi Province (part of Kyoto Prefecture, Nara Province, Osaka Province and part of Hyogo Province) were collectively called the Kinai region (which means within the wall) (the five capital region provinces surrounding Kyoto and Nara.

In ancient times, in many cases, capitals were located in places near Kyoto, Nara and their surrounding area, and areas including Yamashiro Province, Yamao Province, Settsu Province, Kawachi Province and Izumi Province (part of Kyoto Prefecture, Nara Prefecture, Osaka Prefecture and part of Hyogo Prefecture) were collectively called the Kinai region (which means within the wall) (provinces surrounding Kyoto and Nara).
sen.cmt: 原文に沿って修正しました。

sen.j: 天子が直隸する帝都から五百里以内の土地）と呼ばれていた。
sen.e: Kinai region was the land within 500 ri (ri is a Japanese distance unit; one ri = about 3.92 km) from the capital which was under direct control of an emperor).
Kinai region was land within 500 ri (ri is a Japanese distance unit; one ri = about 3.92 km) from the capital which was under direct control of an emperor).
Kinai region was land within 500 ri (ri is a Japanese distance unit; one ri = about 3.92 km) from the capital which was under direct control of an emperor).

sen.j: 現在でいう首都圏と同義である。
sen.e: Kinai had the same meaning as the national capital region at the present time.
Kinai possessed the same meaning as the national capital region at the present time.
Kinai possessed the same meaning as the national capital region at the present time.

tit.e: Cognition of a Capital in Various Ways
Cognition of a Capital in Various Ways
Cognition of a Capital in Various Ways

sen.j: 日本では歴史上天皇による朝廷の他に、国際的には時に「日本国王」「日本国大君」とも称された征夷大将軍による幕府のような武家政権が存在したことや、東京と京都の両京制などの面から首都の議論があり、様々な首都論・首都認識がある。
sen.e: In Japanese history, besides Imperial Court ruled by Emperor, Military government such as Bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) existed at times, Bakufu was headed by a shogun (a barbarian-quelling generalissimo in official name). Therefore, there are various discussions and cognitions of a capital, including both capital systems of Tokyo and Kyoto.

In Japanese history, besides the Imperial Court ruled by the Emperor, military governments such as Bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) existed at times, Bakufu was headed by a shogun (a barbarian-quelling generalissimo in official name). Therefore, there are various discussions and understandings as to what a capital is defined as, including both the capital systems of Tokyo and Kyoto.

In Japanese history, besides the Imperial Court ruled by the Emperor, existed military governments such as Bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun): bakufu was headed by a shogun (a barbarian-quelling generalissimo in official name) who was called at times "the King of Japan" or "the Emperor of Japan", and therefore, there are various discussions and understandings as to what a capital is defined as, including both the capital systems of Tokyo and Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 原文に沿って修正しました。

tit.j: 辞典による日本の首都
tit.e: Capital of Japan depending on various views
Capital of Japan depending on various views
Capital of Japan defined by dictionaries
tit.cmt: 原文に沿って修正しました。

sen.j: 平安遷都など歴代の遷都をそのまま首都の移動とするもの。
sen.e: The view asserting that the successive transfer of capital such as the transfer of capital in Heian era is the movement of capital.
The view asserting that the successive transfer of capitals such as the transfer of capital in Heian era is the movement of capital.
The view asserting that the successive transfer of capitals such as the transfer of capital in Heian era is the movement of capital.

sen.j: 明治2年に東京城（江戸城）が皇城とされ太政官が東京に移されたことと、明治4年府県の順序で東京が第一とされたことで東京が首都の地位を得たとするもの。
sen.e: The view stating that Tokyo acquired the position of capital with the appointment of Tokyo Castle (Edo Castle) as Imperial Palace and the movement of Dajokan (Grand Council of State) to Tokyo, and Tokyo acquired the first position in the order among prefectures in 1871, with which Tokyo got the position of capital.

The view stating that Tokyo acquired the position of capital with the appointment of Tokyo Castle (Edo Castle) as the Imperial Palace and the movement of Dajokan (Grand Council of State) to Tokyo, and Tokyo acquired the first position in the order among prefectures in 1871, with which Tokyo acquired the position of capital.

The view stating that Tokyo acquired the position of capital with the appointment of Tokyo Castle (Edo Castle) as the Imperial Palace and the movement of Dajokan (Grand Council of State) to Tokyo, and Tokyo acquired the first position in the order among prefectures in 1871, with which Tokyo acquired the position of capital.

tit.j: 天皇・都に注目したもの
tit.e: The view that pay attention to the emperor and the seat of government
The view that pays attention to the emperor and the seat of government
Views that pay attention to the emperor and the seat of government
tit.cmt: 原文に沿って修正しました。

sen.j: 京都も東京も帝都だが、本来首都は京都であり、東京は施政の便宜上天皇がいる場所だというもの。
sen.e: The view asserting that Tokyo is an imperial capital, but Kyoto is originally the capital and Tokyo is the place where Emperor exists for convenience'sake.
The view asserting that while Tokyo is an imperial capital, Kyoto is originally the capital and Tokyo is the place where Emperor exists for convenience'sake.
The view asserting that both Kyoto and Tokyo are regarded as imperial capitals, but Kyoto is originally the capital and Tokyo is the place where Emperor exists for convenience'sake.
sen.cmt: 原文に沿って修正しました。

sen.j: 東西の帝都である東京と京都が並立して首都とするもの。
sen.e: The view asserting that Kyoto and Tokyo as imperial capitals are both capitals.
The view asserting both Kyoto and Tokyo as capitals, due to their both being imperial capitals.
The view asserting that Kyoto as the imperial capital in west and Tokyo as the one in east are both capitals equally.
sen.cmt: 原文に沿って修正しました。

sen.j: 江戸時代の首都は将軍の任命が行なわれた京都であり、幕府があった鎌倉・江戸は首都ではなかったとするもの。
sen.e: The view stating that Kyoto was the capital because Shogun was appointed in Kyoto in Kamakura and Edo Periods, and although Bakufu were located in Kamakura and Edo, those cities were not the capitals.

The view stating that Kyoto was the capital because Shogun was appointed in Kyoto in Kamakura and Edo Periods, and although Bakufu were located in Kamakura and Edo, those cities were not the capitals.
The view stating that during the Edo period, Kyoto had been the capital because Shogun was appointed in Kyoto, while Kamakura and Edo were not capitals, although Bakufu were located in these cities.
sen.cmt: 原文に沿って修正しました。

sen.j: 首都移転は皇室の座所の移動（御動座）を伴うものだとするもの（1996年の橋本龍太郎内閣総理大臣の国会答弁）。
sen.e: Relocation of capital should be accompanied with the movement of zasho (a room for a noble person) (an account in the Diet by prime minister Taro Hashimoto in 1996)
Relocation of capital should be accompanied with the movement of zasho (a room for a noble person) (an account in the Diet by prime minister Taro Hashimoto in 1996)
Relocation of capital should be accompanied with the movement of zasho (a room for a noble person) (an account in the Diet by prime minister Ryutaro Hashimoto in 1996)

tit.j: 首都機能・武家政権に注目したもの
tit.e: The view paying attention to the function of capital and samurai (militarist) government.
The view paying attention to the function of capital and samurai (militarist) government.
The view paying attention to the function of capital and samurai (militarist) government.

sen.j: 平氏政権による福原京の計画が平安京との複都構想だったとし、また鎌倉幕府の置かれた鎌倉が、京都と首都機能を分担した事実上の複都制であるとするもの。
sen.e: The view asserting that the plan for Fukuhara-kyo by the Heike family was the plan for system of multi-capital, and the Kamakura, where Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by shogun) was located, bore the functions of capital with Kyoto, therefore, the system of multi-capital existed in Kamakura era.

The view asserting that the plan for Fukuhara-kyo by the Heike family was a plan for a system of multiple capitals, and that Kamakura, where Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by shogun) was located, bore the functions of a capital with Kyoto, therefore, the multi-capital system existed in Kamakura era.

The view asserting that the plan for Fukuhara-kyo by the Heike family was a plan for a system of multiple capitals with Heiankyo, and that Kamakura, where Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by shogun) was located, bore the functions of a capital with Kyoto, therefore, the multi-capital system existed in Kamakura era.

sen.j: 江戸は政府の所在地で首都と意識されていたが、幕末に政治の中心となった京都が首都となり、更にそれが東京に移ったとするもの。
sen.e: The view stating that Edo was felt as capital because of government location, but in the end of Edo period Kyoto became the capital because it came to be the center of politics, and then the capital moved to Tokyo (Edo) again.

The view stating that Edo was regarded as a capital because of its political location, but in the end of the Edo period, Kyoto became the capital because it came to be the center of politics, before the capital moved to Tokyo (Edo) again.

The view stating that Edo was regarded as a capital because of its political location, but in the end of the Edo period, Kyoto became the capital because it came to be the center of politics, before the capital moved to Tokyo (Edo) again.

sen.j: 江戸時代に江戸は政治・行政の中心と認識され、首都として機能もし、外国人も江戸を首都と認識していたとするもの。
sen.e: The view that in Edo era Edo was recognized as the center of politics and administration and functioned as the capital, and it was also recognized by foreigners as the capital.
The view that in Edo era Edo was recognized as the center of politics and administration and functioned as the capital, and it was also recognized by foreigners as the capital.
The view that in Edo era Edo was recognized as the center of politics and administration and functioned as the capital, and it was also recognized by foreigners as the capital.

sen.j: 1719年の朝鮮通信使申維翰の『海遊録』によれば、都（首都）は初め大和にあり、その後豊臣秀吉が大坂に、徳川家康が江戸に移したと認識されていたという。
sen.e: According to "" Kiyuroku "" written by Chosen Tsushinshi, it was recognized that the capital in Japan was located in Yamato at first, after that Hideoyoshi TOYOTOMI moved it to Osaka and then Ieyasu TOKUGAWA transferred it to Edo.

According to "" Kiyuroku "" written by Chosen Tsushinshi, the capital in Japan was first located in Yamat, and after that Hideoyoshi TOYOTOMI moved it to Osaka and then Ieyasu TOKUGAWA transferred it to Edo.

According to "Kaiyuroku" written by Sin Yu-han, a member of Chosen Tsushinshi (the Korean Emissary), the capital in Japan was first located in Yamato, and after that Hideoyoshi TOYOTOMI moved it to Osaka and then Ieyasu TOKUGAWA transferred it to Edo.
sen.cmt: 原文に沿って修正しました。

sen.j: 2009年（平成21年）現在、日本の首都を直接定める現行法令は存在しない。
sen.e: As of 2009, there is no existing law which directly prescribes the capital in Japan.
As of 2009, there is no existing law which directly prescribes the capital in Japan.
As of 2009, there is no existing law which directly prescribes the capital in Japan.

sen.j: そこで、旧法、現行法及び慣習法の読み方によって、東京（東京都）を唯一の首都と解さない論者もいる。
sen.e: Therefore, some advocates do not take Tokyo as only the capital of Japan by interpretation difference of old laws, existing laws and common laws.
Therefore, some advocates do not take Tokyo as the only capital of Japan by interpreting the difference between old laws, existing laws and common laws.
Therefore, some advocates do not take Tokyo as the only capital of Japan by interpreting the difference between old laws, existing laws and common laws.

sen.j: 論争に登場する主要な立法およびその解釈について列記する。
sen.e: In the following paragraphs, we list the main legislaion and their interpretation.
In the following paragraphs, we list the main legislaion and their interpretation.
In the following paragraphs, we list the main legislaion and their interpretation.

sen.j: 1868年（明治元年）、天皇が京都から東京へ行幸するに際して発せられた江戸ヲ称シテ東京ト為スノ詔書には、「首都」の語はない。
sen.e: In the imperial edict (shosho), issued at the time of imperial visit to Tokyo from Kyoto in 1868, there was no word of " capital ".
In the imperial edict (shosho), issued at the time of imperial visit to Tokyo from Kyoto in 1868, there was no word for " capital ".

sen.j: 首都を意味する「京」を地名に付したことから、この詔書によって、東京を首都に定めたと見るのが有力だが、反論もある。
sen.e: According to the leading view that because of giving the area name " Kyo " which means the "capital ", Tokyo was established as the capital with this edict, but there are opposite views.

sen.j: この詔書の趣旨について、東京を京都と並び首都とすること（複都論）を定めたに過ぎないと解する立場がある。
sen.e: Concerning this edict, another view asserts plural capitals in which Tokyo is the capital along with Kyoto.
Concerning this edict, another view asserts multiple capitals in which Tokyo is the capital along with Kyoto.
Concerning this edict, another view asserts multiple capitals in which Tokyo is the capital along with Kyoto.

sen.j: 1923年（大正12年）に発せられた関東大震災直後ノ詔書（大正12年9月12日）では、東京がすでに首都であることを既定のこととして記載された文言が出てくる。
sen.e: In the imperial edict (September 12th, 1923) issued just after the Great Kanto Earthquake in 1923, there was the following wording expressing that Tokyo was the capital, as the established fact and it should be transformed and developed further.

sen.j: …抑モ東京ハ帝国ノ首都ニシテ政治経済ノ枢軸トナリ国民文化ノ源泉トナリテ民衆一般ノ瞻仰スル所ナリ一朝不慮ノ災害ニ罹リテ今ヤ其ノ旧形ヲ留メスト雖依然トシテ我国都タル地位ヲ失ハス是ヲ以テ其ノ善後策ハ独リ旧態ヲ回復スルニ止マラス進ンテ将来ノ発展ヲ図リ以テ巷衢ノ面目ヲ新ニセサルヘカラス…
sen.e: " Tokyo is the capital of the empire and the political and economic center, and the source of nation's culture. Tokyo suffered a big disaster this time and can not hold its old situation, but it still holds the status of capital of the empire, therefore, it is necessary not only restore old situation but also undergo a complete new transformation."

"Tokyo is the capital of the empire and the political and economic center, and the source of Japan's culture. Tokyo suffered an enormous disaster this time and can not cling to its old situation, but still holds status as capital of the empire, therefore, it is necessary not only to restore it to what it used to be but also have it undergo a complete new transformation."

"Tokyo is the capital of the empire and the political and economic center, and the source of Japan's culture. Tokyo suffered an enormous disaster this time and can not cling to its old situation, but still holds status as capital of the empire, therefore, it is necessary not only to restore it to what it used to be but also have it undergo a complete new transformation."

sen.j: 1943年（昭和18年）に制定された東京都制（昭和18年法律第89号）では、「効率的な首都行政を行うことを目的とする」と、立法段階で説明されている。
sen.e: In Tokyo regulation established in 1943 (law No. 89, 1943), it is explained at the stage of its legislation as follows. " Tokyo aims to enforce an effective administration."
In Tokyo, a regulation established in 1943 (law No. 89, 1943), explained the stage of its legislation as follows. "Tokyo aims to enforce an effective administration."

sen.j: ただし、地方自治法において、「都」制度が道府県制度と並び規定されているが、都制度の適用があるのは、現在の東京都を区域とする地方自治体に限定されるとは規定されず、また、いわゆる首都の所在地の自治体に適用されるという規定もない。
sen.e: However, in the Local Autonomy Law, " Metropolis system " is stipulated along with prefectural system, but it is not stipulated that application of Metropolis system is limited only to Tokyo, and there is no regulation that Metropolis system should be applied only to the municipality near the location of Tokyo. For example, Osaka prefecture can be reformed to " Osaka Metropolis ".

However, in the Local Autonomy Law, " Metropolis system " is stipulated along with the prefectural system, but it is not stipulated that application of the Metropolis system is limited only to Tokyo, and there is no regulation says the Metropolis system should be applied only to the municipality near the location of Tokyo. For example, Osaka prefecture can be reformed to " Osaka Metropolis ".

However, in the Local Autonomy Law, "Metropolis system" is stipulated along with the prefectural system, but it is not stipulated that application of the Metropolis system is limited only to Tokyo, and there is no regulation says the Metropolis system should be applied only to the municipality near the location of Tokyo.

sen.j: 例えば大阪府を「大阪都」に改めることもあり得るとされている。

sen.j: 1950年（昭和25年）には、東京都を日本の新しい首都とすることが明確に定められた首都建設法が制定された。
sen.e: In 1950, Capital Construction law was established expressly ruling Tokyo as the new capital of Japan.
In 1950, Capital Construction law was established expressly ruling Tokyo as the new capital of Japan.
In 1950, Capital Construction law was established expressly ruling Tokyo as the new capital of Japan.

sen.j: 同法は、当時数多く制定された特別都市建設法の一つである。
sen.e: The law was one of the special city construction laws which were established in those days.
The law was one of the special city construction laws which were established during those days.

sen.j: 首都建設法（昭和25年法律第219号）
sen.e: Capital Construction Law (Law No. 219, 1950)
Capital Construction Law (Law No. 219, 1950)
Capital Construction Law (Law No. 219, 1950)

sen.j: 第一条 この法律は、東京都を新しく我が平和国家の首都として十分にその政治、経済、文化等についての機能を発揮し得るよう計画し、建設することを目的とする。
sen.e: Article 1: This law aims to plan and construct Tokyo Metropolis so as to develop fully the functions of politics, economy and culture of Tokyo as the capital of the peace state.
Article 1: This law aims to plan and construct Tokyo Metropolis so as to develop fully the functions of politics, economy and culture of Tokyo as the capital of the peace state.
Article 1: This law aims to plan and construct Tokyo Metropolis so as to develop fully the functions of politics, economy and culture of Tokyo as the capital of the peace state.

sen.j: 第十二条 東京都の区域により行う都市計画事業については、東京都が国の首都であることにかんがみて必要と認めるときは、建設省、運輸省その他その事業の内容である事項を主管する行政官庁がこれを執行することができる。
sen.e: Article 12: Concerning the city planning activities enforced depending on the area of Tokyo Metropolis, related administrative ministries such as Ministry of Construction, Ministry of Transport and others can execute those activities, if they are recognized necessary, considering that Tokyo is the Capital of Japan.

Article 12: Concerning the city planning activities enforced depending on the area of Tokyo Metropolis, related administrative ministries such as the Ministry of Construction, Ministry of Transport and others can execute those activities, if they are recognized to be necessary, based on Tokyo being considered to be the Capital of Japan.

Article 12: Concerning the city planning activities enforced depending on the area of Tokyo Metropolis, related administrative ministries such as the Ministry of Construction, Ministry of Transport and others can execute those activities, if they are recognized to be necessary, based on Tokyo being considered to be the Capital of Japan.

sen.j: この場合においては、東京都及びその区域内の関係地方公共団体の同意を得なければならない。
sen.e: In these cases, it is necessary to obtain the consent from Tokyo and the related local public body in that area.
In these cases, it is necessary to obtain consent from Tokyo and the related local public body in that area.
In these cases, it is necessary to obtain consent from Tokyo and the related local public body in that area.

sen.j: のちに同法は廃止されたが、廃止理由は、東京都が首都でなくなったからではなく、あくまで同法の目的（首都の建設）が達成され、整備の対象を「首都」から「首都とその周辺地域」に広げるための発展的なものであり、後継の首都圏整備法とは連続性、一体性を有するものである。
sen.e: Although this law was abolished afterwards, the reason for abolition was not because Tokyo ceased to be the capital, but because the object of the law (construction of capital) was accomplished and it has come to be necessary to develop the object of city improvement from Tokyo to the place including Tokyo and its surrounding area. Therefore, the abolition was of developing nature and it has the continuity and nature of integration with the following " national capital region improvement law ".

Although this law was abolished later, it was not because Tokyo ceased to be the capital, but because the object of the law (construction of capital) was accomplished and it has come to be necessary to develop the object of city improvement from Tokyo to the place including Tokyo and its surrounding area. Therefore, the abolition was of developing nature and it has the continuity and nature of integration with the following " National Capital Region Improvement Law ".
sen.cmt: "to develop the object of city improvement from Tokyo to the place including Tokyo and its surrounding area" doesn't make sense
sen.e: Although this law was abolished later, it was not because Tokyo ceased to be the capital, but because the objective of the law (construction of capital) was accomplished and it was necessary to expand the area of city improvement from the capital to the capital and its surrounding region; the succeeding law, 'national capital region improvement law,' has a continuity and unity with the abolished law.
sen.cmt: 原文に沿って修正しました。

sen.j: そのため、新規に廃止法を制定するのではなく、後継法の附則により廃止する形を採った。
sen.e: For this reason, they did not establish a new abolition law, but took the style of abolition by additional rules in the following law.
For this reason, they did not establish a new abolition law, but instead chose to add rules in the following law.
For this reason, they did not establish a new abolition law, but instead chose to add rules in the following law.

sen.j: 首都圏とは「首都＋圏（その周辺地域）」のことであるが、後継法では「首都」部分は前身法で既に首都と定めた「東京都」と明確に定めることで、その変更には国会の議決を義務付け、「その周辺地域」部分は下位法令（政令）に委任することで、国会の議決なく柔軟に変更できる余地を残す形で、前身法の首都の定義を継承している。
sen.e: The national capital region means the region " capital + its surrounding area ", but in the successive law, it is clearly defined that " national capital region " part is " Tokyo Metropolis " established in predecessor law (abolished law) and it imposes the obligation of Diet vote in order to change that part. Concerning " the surrounding area "the new law took over predecessor law, in the way to delegate the lower rank act (government ordinance) and not to require Diet vote and flexibly change " the surrounding area " part.

The national capital region refers to the region " capital + its surrounding area ", but in the successive law, it is clearly defined that " national capital region " part is " Tokyo Metropolis " established in predecessor law (abolished law) and it imposes the obligation of Diet vote in order to change that part. Concerning " the surrounding area "the new law took over predecessor law, in the way to delegate the lower rank act (government ordinance) and not to require Diet vote and flexibly change " the surrounding area " part.

The national capital region refers to the region 'the capital and its surrounding area,' but in the succeeding law, it is clearly defined that 'national capital' part is 'Tokyo Metropolis' established in predecessor law (abolished law) and it imposes the obligation of Diet vote in order to change that part, and concerning 'the surrounding area' the new law took over predecessor law, in the way to delegate the lower rank act (government ordinance) and not to require Diet vote and flexibly change 'the surrounding area' part.
sen.cmt: 原文に沿って修正しました。スペース調整をしました。クォーテーション調整

sen.j: 皇居の所在地（＝首都とする説）の変遷
sen.e: Change of the Imperial Palace Address (= View that the Imperial Palace Address is the national capital region)
Change of the Imperial Palace Address (= View that the Imperial Palace Address is the national capital region)

sen.j: 歴史上、日本の首都は、天皇の住まいである皇居の所在によって定められた。
sen.e: In history, Japanese capital was determined by the address of Imperial Palace, Emperor residence.
In history, Japanese capital was determined by the address of the Imperial Palace, the Emperor's residence.
In history, Japanese capital was determined by the address of the Imperial Palace, the Emperor's residence.

sen.j: 古墳時代以降は、皇居のための宮殿（御所）建設と周辺の市街地整備を一体として行い、首都にふさわしい都市を計画的に建設するようになった。
sen.e: After Tumulus period, construction of Imperial Palace and improvement of urban area were carried out simultaneously and came to construct systematically the city suitable to the capital.
After Tumulus period, construction of the Imperial Palace and improvement of urban areas were carried out simultaneously and came to construct systematically the city suitable to the capital.
sen.cmt: "came to construct systematically the city suitable to the capital. " doesn't make sense
sen.e: After Tumulus period, it became to carry out the construction of the Imperial Palace and improvement of urban areas simultaneously and to build a city suitable to a capital in a well-planned way.
sen.cmt: 原文に沿って修正しました。

sen.j: 宮殿や貴族の邸宅であっても、奈良時代までは基本的に掘立柱建物だったため、建物の耐用年数が短かった。
sen.e: Until Nara period, even if the structure were for the palace and residences of nobles, they were of earthfast post architechture, therefore their lives were short.
Until the Nara period, even if the structure were built in order to act as palaces and residences of nobles, they were earthfast post architecture, and hence did not last very long.
Until the Nara period, even imperial palaces and residences of nobles were earthfast post architecture, and hence did not last very long.
sen.cmt: 原文に沿って修正しました。

sen.j: 同じ掘立柱建築である伊勢神宮の遷宮は20年に1回である。
sen.e: Transferring of Ise-jingu Shrine which was of earthfast post architechture was conducted once in every 20 years.
The transfer of Ise-jingu Shrine, which was an earthfast post architechture was conducted once every 20 years.
The sengu (transfer of a deity to a new shrine building) of Ise-jingu Shrine which is an earthfast post architechture is conducted once every 20 years.
sen.cmt: 伊勢神宮の遷宮は未だに行われているので現在形にしました。用語共有に沿って説明を加えました。

sen.j: 古代の頻繁な遷都や宮殿の移転・新築は、政治的な思惑の他にも建築物の耐用年数の影響が考えられる。
sen.e: It is thought that the frequent transfer of the capital and new construction of palace were due to the influence of their short architechture lives.
It is thought that the frequent transfer of the capital and new construction of a palace were due to the influence of their short architectural lives.
It is thought that the frequent transfer of the capital and new construction of a palace were due to the influence of their short architectural lives in addition to political motives.
sen.cmt: 政治的な思惑を追加しました。

sen.j: 中国風の都市計画を持ち込んだ藤原京・平城京・平安京などでは、計画的な庶民の居住を促しても、家が掘立柱建築だったために、地下水位の高い低湿地や河川の氾濫原は居住に適さないとして放棄され、いずれも当初の計画とは異なる都市へと変化した。
sen.e: In Fujiwara Capital (694-710), Heijo Capital and Heian Capital in which they introduced Chinese city plan, although they promoted the living of the common people, their houses were of earthfast, therefore wetlands and floodable shores of rivers were abandoned because of unfitting for living, and so situations of cities changed different from original plans.

In Fujiwara Capital (694-710), Heijo Capital and Heian Capital which introduced a Chinese city plan, and promoted as a place for common folk, were of earthfast architecture, therefore the wetlands and shores of rivers prone to flooding were abandoned due to their being unfit for living, changing the situation of the cities from the original plans.

In Fujiwarakyo capital, Heijokyo capital, and Heiankyo capital which introduced a Chinese city plan, and promoted as a place for common folk, were of earthfast architecture, therefore the wetlands and shores of rivers prone to flooding were abandoned due to their being unfit for living, changing the location of the cities from the original plans.
sen.cmt: 原文に沿って修正しました。

sen.j: 飛鳥宮（飛鳥時代）以前に、首都に相当する都城は存在しない。
sen.e: Before the Asuka Imperial Palace, there was no capital corresponding to a capital zone..
Before the Asuka Imperial Palace, there was no capital corresponding to a capital zone.
Before the Asuka Imperial Palace (Asuka period), there was no capital corresponding to a capital zone.
sen.cmt: 飛鳥時代を追加しました。

sen.j: 奈良時代に編まれた記紀によれば、歴代大王 (ヤマト王権)の宮室が磯城 ・磐余（奈良県桜井市）のほか、難波 ・河内国地方（大阪府）などに複数営まれたため、各々の宮室を中心に萌芽的な都邑が形成されていたことも考えられる。
sen.e: According to " Records of Ancient Matters " and " Chronicles of Japan " edited in Nara period, it is thought that the cities centering around each palace were born in a germinal stage, because the palaces of successive great kings were constructed in Shiki, Iware (Sakurai City, Nara Prefecture), Nanba and Kawachi Provinces (Osaka Prefecture).

According to " Records of Ancient Matters " and " Chronicles of Japan " edited in Nara period, it is thought that the cities centering around each palace were born in a germinal stage, because the palaces of successive great kings were constructed in Shiki, Iware (Sakurai City, Nara Prefecture), Nanba and Kawachi Provinces (Osaka Prefecture).
sen.cmt: " were born in a germinal stage" does not make sense
sen.e: According to "Records of Ancient Matters" and "Chronicles of Japan" edited in Nara period, it is thought that as an initial stage of capital, cities centering around palaces sprang up, because the palaces of successive great kings (Yamato sovereignty) (the ancient Japan sovereignty) were constructed in multiple places including Shiki, Iware (Sakurai City, Nara Prefecture), Nanba and Kawachi Provinces (Osaka Prefecture).
sen.cmt: 原文に沿って修正しました。

sen.j: しかし、その具体的な遺構は未発見である。
sen.e: However, their concrete ancient structural remnants are undiscovered.
However, their concrete ancient structural remnants remain undiscovered.
However, their concrete ancient structural remnants remain undiscovered.

sen.j: 記紀に見える宮室については、「皇居歴代の皇居」を参照。
sen.e: Reference: The article of " Imperial Palace in successive Imperial Families " as for palaces which appear in " Records of Ancient Matters " and " Chronicles of Japan "
Reference: The article of " Imperial Palace in successive Imperial Families " as for palaces which appear in " Records of Ancient Matters " and " Chronicles of Japan "
Reference: The article of " Imperial Palace in successive Imperial Families " as for palaces which appear in " Records of Ancient Matters " and " Chronicles of Japan "

sen.j: なお、飛鳥 - 奈良時代には、首都機能を経済 ・交通の面で補完する第二首都とも言うべき複都制（陪都）が設けられていた時期があった（首都世界の首都）。
sen.e: In addition, in Asuka and Nara periods, there were eras in which systems of multi-capital (which might be called the second capital) were established in order to complement capital functions in economics and transportation.

In addition, in the Asuka and Nara periods, there were eras in which systems of multi-capital (which might be called the second capital) were established in order to complement capital functions in economics and transportation.

In addition, in the Asuka and Nara periods, there were eras in which systems of multi-capital (which might be called the second capital) were established in order to complement capital functions in economics and transportation.

sen.j: 例としては、最初にこの制度を採用した天武天皇の難波宮を始め、淳仁天皇の「北京」保良宮（滋賀県大津市、761年 - 764年）、称徳天皇の「西京」由義宮（大阪府八尾市、769年 - 770年）が知られている。
sen.e: As those examples, Naniwanomiya Palace of Emperor Tenmu who took this system for the first time, " Beijin " Horanomiya (detached palace) of Emperor Junnin (Otsu City, Shiga Prefecture, 761-764) and " Nishikyo " Yugenomiya (detatched palace) of Empress Shotoku (Yao City, Osaka Prefecture, 769-770) are known.

As examples, Naniwanomiya Palace of Emperor Tenmu who took this system for the first time, " Beijin " Horanomiya (detached palace) of Emperor Junnin (Otsu City, Shiga Prefecture, 761-764) and " Nishikyo " Yugenomiya (detatched palace) of Empress Shotoku (Yao City, Osaka Prefecture, 769-770) are known.

As examples, Naniwanomiya Palace of Emperor Tenmu who took this system for the first time, 'Beijin' Horanomiya (detached palace) of Emperor Junnin (Otsu City, Shiga Prefecture, 761-764) and 'Nishikyo' Yugenomiya (detatched palace) of Empress Shotoku (Yao City, Osaka Prefecture, 769-770) are known.
sen.cmt: クォーテーション調整

sen.j: 保良宮と由義宮は短命に終わったが、難波宮は長岡京遷都まで副都の地位を保ち続けた。
sen.e: Horanomiya and Yugenomiya were short in their lives, but Naniwanomiya Palace maintained the position of secondary capital city until Transferring of the national capital to Nagaoka.
Horanomiya and Yugenomiya were short lived, but Naniwanomiya Palace maintained its position as secondary capital city until the transfer of the national capital to Nagaoka.
Horanomiya and Yugenomiya were short lived, but Naniwanomiya Palace maintained its position as secondary capital city until the transfer of the national capital to Nagaoka.

sen.j: 平安時代末の福原京を首都とみなせるか否かについては近年議論がある。
sen.e: There have been a discussion whether to consider Fukuhara-kyo as a capital or not.
There have been discussions as to whether to consider Fukuhara-kyo as a capital.
There have been discussions as to whether to consider Fukuhara-kyo as a capital.

sen.j: 首都否定論の立場からは、『平家物語』などの文学作品に語られる「福原遷都」の実態については、平氏政権が和田（神戸市）方面への遷都を目的として福原に行宮を置いたに過ぎず、それによって平安京が従来の首都機能を失った様子も特に見られないことから、建前はどうあれ、福原は京都の機能を軍事・貿易面で補完する事実上の副都に留まった、とする主張がある。
sen.e: From the standpoint of negative capital, on the actual condition of " Transfer of the capital to Fukuhara talked in the literary work such as " the Tale of Heike ", there is an insistence that Taira clan government set Angu (tentative capital) in Fukuhara only with the purpose of transfer of the capital and since no situation could be seen that Heian-Kyo lost the traditional capital function, Fukuhara ended up to be the sub-capital to complement the function of Kyoto in military and trade functions.

From the standpoint of negative capital, on the actual condition of " Transfer of the capital to Fukuhara talked in the literary work such as " the Tale of Heike ", some insist that the Taira clan government set Angu (tentative capital) in Fukuhara only for the purposes of transfering the captial, and since Heian-Kyo did not lose any function as a traditional capital, Fukuhara ended up being the sub-capital to complement Kyoto in military and trade functions.

From the standpoint of negative capital, on the actual condition of 'Transfer of the capital to Fukuhara' talked in the literary work such as "the Tale of Heike," some insist that the Taira clan government set Angu (tentative capital) in Fukuhara only for the purposes of transfering the captial toward Wada (Kobe City), and since Heian-Kyo did not lose any function as a traditional capital, Fukuhara ended up being the sub-capital to complement Kyoto in military and trade functions.
sen.cmt: 和田（神戸市）を追加しました。クォーテーション調整

sen.j: 実際、福原への遷都宣言が出されたことはなく、行宮滞在中も行事は京都で行われている上、遷都計画が頓挫した後は、京都を首都とする方針が政権中枢にて決定されている。
sen.e: In fact, edict for the transfer of the capital to Fukuhara was not issued, rites and festivals conducted in Kyoto even while Angu was set up in Fukuhara,and after capital transfer plan was suddenly checked, the policy of setting the capital in Kyoto was decided by the chief executives of the government.

In fact,the edict for the transfer of the capital to Fukuhara was not issued, and rites and festivals were conducted in Kyoto even while Angu was set up in Fukuhara,and after capital transfer plan was suddenly checked, the policy of setting the capital in Kyoto was decided by the chief executives of the government.
sen.cmt: "and after capital transfer plan was suddenly checked," doesn't make sense
sen.e: In fact,the edict for the transfer of the capital to Fukuhara was not issued, and rites and festivals were conducted in Kyoto even while Angu was set up in Fukuhara,and after the capital transfer plan came to a sudden stop, the policy of setting the capital in Kyoto was decided by the chief executives of the government.
sen.cmt: 原文に沿って修正しました。

sen.j: これに反し、福原には朝堂院や官衙の整備計画も持ち上がったが、結局実行されなかった（『玉葉』治承4年7月16日条・8月4日条・11日条・29日条）。
sen.e: While improvement plan of Chodo-in and government office were proposed in Fukuhara, but they were not carried out in the end ("" Gyokuyo""(Diary of Kanezane KUJO, July 16th, August 4th, 11th, Jisho era 4,)
While the Chodo-in and government office were proposed in Fukuhara, they were not carried out in the end ("" Gyokuyo""(Diary of Kanezane KUJO, July 16th, August 4th, 11th, Jisho era 4,)

While the Chodo-in and government office were proposed in Fukuhara, they were not carried out in the end ("Gyokuyo" (Diary of Kanezane KUJO, July 16th, August 4th, 11th, Jisho era 4) (the old lunar calendar)
sen.cmt: スペース調整をしました。(the old lunar calendar)を追加しました。

sen.j: 南北朝時代 (日本)（1336年 - 1392年）は、「観応の擾乱正平一統」（1351年 - 1352年）の短期間を除き平安京が北朝 (日本)の首都である。
sen.e: During the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan) (1336-1392), except for the short time of Kanno Disturbance (1351-1352), Heian-Kyo was the capital of Northern Court (Japan).
During the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan) (1336-1392), except for the short time of Kanno Disturbance (1351-1352), Heian-Kyo was the capital of the Northern Court (Japan).
During the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan) (1336-1392), except for the short time of Kanno Disturbance (1351-1352), Heian-Kyo was the capital of the Northern Court (Japan).

sen.j: ただし、南朝 (日本)の本拠は全て行宮、すなわち仮の拠点として扱われ、正式な首都は平安京と見なしていたと推測される。
sen.e: But it is presumed that the headquarter of Southern Court was treated as Angu (a tentative foothold), and Heian-Kyo was regarded official capital.
But it is presumed that the headquarter of Southern Court was treated as Angu (a tentative foothold), and Heian-Kyo was regarded the official capital.
But it is presumed that the headquarter of Southern Court was treated as Angu (a tentative foothold), and Heian-Kyo was regarded the official capital.

sen.j: 日清戦争中の1894年には、広島県広島市に明治天皇が行幸して、大本営も移った。
sen.e: During Sino-Japanese War in 1894, Emperor Meiji visited Hiroshima City, Hiroshima Prefecture and the Imperial headquarters was also transferred there.
During the Sino-Japanese War in 1894, Emperor Meiji visited Hiroshima City, Hiroshima Prefecture and the Imperial headquarters was also transferred there.
During the Sino-Japanese War in 1894, Emperor Meiji visited Hiroshima City, Hiroshima Prefecture and the Imperial headquarters was also transferred there.

sen.j: 帝国議会も開催されるなど、一時的に首都機能が移転し、臨時首都の様相を呈した。
sen.e: In Hiroshima City, Imperial Diet was opened and capital function was tentatively transferred there, and Hiroshima City assumed the aspect of tentative capital.
In Hiroshima City, the Imperial Diet was opened and capital functions were tentatively transferred to this location, and Hiroshima City temporarily assumed the status of capital.
In Hiroshima City, the Imperial Diet was opened and capital functions were tentatively transferred to this location, and Hiroshima City temporarily assumed the status of capital.

sen.j: 太平洋戦争末期の1944年には、皇居と大本営を長野県松代町 (長野県)（現長野市）に移転させる計画が大日本帝国陸軍により始められたが、敗戦により中止された（松代大本営）。
sen.e: In 1944 at the end of Pacific War, Army of the Great Empire of Japan started the plan to move Imperial Palace and the Imperial headquarters to Matsushiro Machi, Nagano Prefecture (present Nagano City), but the plan was suspended because of the end of war (Matsushiro Imperial headquarters).

In 1944 at the end of Pacific War, the Army of the Great Empire of Japan started a plan to move the Imperial Palace and the Imperial headquarters to Matsushiro Machi, Nagano Prefecture (present Nagano City), but the plan was suspended due to the end of the war (Matsushiro Imperial headquarters).

In 1944 at the end of Pacific War, the Army of the Great Empire of Japan started a plan to move the Imperial Palace and the Imperial headquarters to Matsushiro Machi, Nagano Prefecture (present Nagano City), but the plan was suspended due to the end of the war (Matsushiro Imperial headquarters).
